prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
	diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
I apologize for the confusion. It seems your group variable only has a single factor. This means that the contrast argument is not needed. Here is your fixed R script:

```
# load necessary packages
library(readxl)
library(DESeq2)
library(ggplot2)
library(Biobase)
library(pcaExplorer)

# Read your data
RNA_counts <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")
row.names(RNA_counts) <- RNA_counts$Genes

meta_data <- read.csv("SRP021193.colData.tsv", sep="\t", row.names=1, header=TRUE)

# Check if column names of both dataset matches 
if(!identical(colnames(RNA_counts)[-1], rownames(meta_data))) {
  stop("Mismatch between column names of counts data and row names of meta data.")
}

# Set up the DESeq2 object
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = RNA_counts[,-1], 
                              colData = meta_data, 
                              design = ~ group)

# Conduct DESeq2 analysis
dds <- DESeq(dds)
results <- results(dds)

# Extract the group specific genes
resOrdered <- results[order(results$pvalue),]
# Threshold for significance can be adjusted
significantGenes <- rownames(resOrdered)[which(resOrdered$padj < 0.05)]
countDataSubset <- RNA_counts[,c(1, which(colnames(RNA_counts) %in% significantGenes))]

# Conduct PCA
sds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = countDataSubset[,-1], 
                              colData = meta_data, 
                              design = ~ group)

vsd <- varianceStabilizingTransformation(sds, blind=FALSE)
pcaData <- plotPCA(vsd, intgroup=c("group"), returnData=TRUE)
percentVar <- round(100 * attr(pcaData, "percentVar"))

# Plot PCA with different color for each group
ggplot(pcaData, aes(PC1, PC2, color=group)) +
  geom_point(size=3) +
  xlab(paste0("PC1: ",percentVar[1],"% variance")) +
  ylab(paste0("PC2: ",percentVar[2],"% variance")) +
  coord_fixed()
```

This time, I've removed the contrast argument from the `results` function. Now, it should work for your case.
